definitions.definition: An informal alliance or friendly understanding between two states.
Articles used in charging firearms and ordnance of all kinds; as powder, balls, shot, shells, percussion caps, rockets, etc.
Military stores, or provisions of all kinds for attack or defense.
definitions.example: ammunition bread; ammunition shoes

definitions.definition: Arguments and information that can be used against the other party in a conflict
To supply with ammunition.
A large store containing many different departments, each of which deals in the sale of different goods or services.
A shelf that is affixed to the wall above a fireplace.
In an implicit or implied manner.
A writ in law used by the superior courts to remove cases from inferior courts.
A writ to enforce appearance in court by attaching goods or requiring securities.
A baked or fried cornbread (bread made of cornmeal), often made without milk or eggs.
The last player to bet or play in turn.
Very poor.
Voluntary isolation from others, especially in order to avoid spreading a communicable disease.
A room in some public place for people to wait.
(grammar) A construction in which one noun or noun phrase is placed with another as an explanatory equivalent, both of them having the same syntactic function in the sentence.
The relationship between such nouns or noun phrases.
The quality of being side-by-side, apposed instead of being opposed, not being front-to-front but next to each other.
A placing of two things side by side, or the fitting together of two things.
In biology, the growth of successive layers of a cell wall.
Appositio
A public disputation by scholars.
A (now purely ceremonial) speech day at St Paul's School, London.
Any of the burrowing mammals covered with bony, jointed, protective plates, order Cingulata, found in the Americas, especially in South America.
A visible, audible, mechanical, or electronic signal used as a reference to determine the time of day
A wireless telecommunications device that receives text or voice messages.
A computer program running in a text terminal, used to view (but not modify) the contents of a text file moving down the file one line or one screen at a time.
(in combination) Something (a document, book etc.) that has a specified number of pages.
To break or separate into pieces; to disintegrate or come apart.
definitions.example: It broke up when it hit the ground.

definitions.definition: To end a relationship.
definitions.example: She broke up with her boyfriend last week.

definitions.definition: To end a relationship with each other.
definitions.example: Jane and Stephen broke up.

definitions.definition: To dissolve; to part.
definitions.example: The meeting finally broke up after a three-hour discussion.

definitions.definition: Of a school, to close for the holidays at the end of term.
Of a telephone conversation, to cease to be understandable because of a bad connection.
definitions.example: You're breaking up. Can you repeat that?

definitions.definition: To break or separate into pieces.
definitions.example: Break up the cheese and put it in the salad.

definitions.definition: To stop a fight; to separate people who are fighting.
definitions.example: The police came in to break up the disturbance.

definitions.definition: Become disorganised
A slight coloring.
A pale or faint tinge of any color; especially, a variation of a color obtained by adding white (contrast shade)
A color considered with reference to other very similar colors.
definitions.example: Red and blue are different colors, but two shades of scarlet are different tints.

definitions.definition: A shaded effect in engraving, produced by the juxtaposition of many fine parallel lines.
To shade, to color.
To split or separate (something) into two or more parts.
definitions.example: a wall divides two houses; a stream divides the towns

definitions.definition: To share (something) by dividing it.
definitions.example: How shall we divide this pie?

definitions.definition: (with by) To calculate the number (the quotient) by which you must multiply one given number (the divisor) to produce a second given number (the dividend).
definitions.example: If you divide 6 by 3, you get 2.

definitions.definition: To be a divisor of.
definitions.example: 3 divides 6.

definitions.definition: To separate into two or more parts.
Of a cell, to reproduce by dividing.
To disunite in opinion or interest; to make discordant or hostile; to set at variance.
To break friendship; to fall out.
To have a share; to partake.

To vote, as in the British parliament and other legislatures, by the members separating themselves into two parties (as on opposite sides of the hall or in opposite lobbies), that is, the ayes dividing from the noes.
To mark divisions on; to graduate.
definitions.example: to divide a sextant

definitions.definition: To play or sing in a florid style, or with variations.
Separated or split into pieces
Having conflicting interests or emotions
Disunited
(of a road) separated into lanes, that move in opposite directions, by a median
The activity of combining parkour with gymnastics to pass obstacles and demonstrate athletic talent, most often in urban environments.
A tree or shrub in any species of the genus Magnolia, many with large flowers and simple leaves.
The flower of a magnolia tree.
A native or resident of the American state of Mississippi.
A creamy white colour, like that of some magnolia flowers.
Of a creamy white colour, like that of some magnolia flowers.
A large plot of land used for raising cattle, sheep or other livestock.
A small farm that cultivates vegetables and/or livestock, especially one in the Southwestern United States.
A house or property on a plot of ranch land.
Ranch dressing.
To operate a ranch; engage in ranching.
definitions.example: Formally the widow still ranches, but in fact she leaves all ranching to the foreman.

definitions.definition: To work on a ranch
A style of music combining elements of jazz and blues, with syncopated rhythms and a strong backbeat, originating among African Americans in the 1940s.
Shoes
A thing whose name cannot be remembered; thingamajig, doohickey.
Any device or machine, especially one whose name cannot be recalled. Often either clever or complicated.
definitions.example: He bought a neat new gadget for shredding potatoes.

definitions.definition: Any consumer electronics product.
A sequence of machine code instructions crafted as part of an exploit that attempts to divert execution to a memory location chosen by the attacker.
A person who feels compelled to work excessively.
definitions.example: All workaholics should move to Hong Kong, where working hours average over 50 per week.

definitions.definition: In the nature or manner of a workaholic.
To persist steadfastly in pursuit of an undertaking, task, journey, or goal, even if hindered by distraction, difficulty, obstacles, or discouragement.
To stay constant; to continue in a certain state; to remain.
Perseverance
Tending to persevere.
The quality of being futile or useless.
definitions.example: His taking the bar exam for a third time was pure futility.

definitions.definition: Something, especially an act, that is futile.
Unimportance.
One of the chief divisions of a long poem; a book.
The treble or leading melody.
The act of wilting or the state of being wilted.
Any of various plant diseases characterized by wilting.
To droop or become limp and flaccid (as a dying leaf or flower).
To fatigue; to lose strength.
To cause to droop or become limp and flaccid (as a flower).
To cause to fatigue; to exhaust.
(now uncommon or literary) To wish, desire (something).
definitions.example: Do what you will.

definitions.definition: (nowadays rare) To wish or desire (that something happen); to intend (that).
(auxiliary) To habitually do (a given action).
(auxiliary) To choose to (do something); used to express intention but without any temporal connotations (+ bare infinitive), often in negation.
definitions.example: I’ve told him three times, but he won’t take his medicine.

definitions.definition: (auxiliary) Used to express the future tense, sometimes with some implication of volition when used in the first person. Compare shall.
(auxiliary) To be able to, to have the capacity to.
definitions.example: Unfortunately, only one of these gloves will actually fit over my hand.

definitions.definition: (auxiliary) Expressing a present tense with some conditional or subjective weakening: "will turn out to", "must by inference".
To wish, desire.
To instruct (that something be done) in one's will.
To try to make (something) happen by using one's will (intention).
definitions.example: All the fans were willing their team to win the game.

definitions.definition: To bequeath (something) to someone in one's will (legal document).
definitions.example: He willed his stamp collection to the local museum.

definitions.definition: Going beyond what is right, proper, or appropriate because of an excess of self-confidence or arrogance.
The result of having been worn away or eroded, as by a glacier on rock or the sea on a cliff face.
The changing of a surface by mechanical action, friction, thermal expansion contraction, or impact.
The gradual loss of something as a result of an ongoing process.
definitions.example: the erosion of a person's trust

definitions.definition: Destruction by abrasive action of fluids.
(image processing) One of two fundamental operations in morphological image processing from which all other morphological operations are derived.
Loss of tooth enamel due to non-bacteriogenic chemical processes.
A shallow ulceration or lesion, usually involving skin or epithelial tissue.
In morphology, a basic operation (denoted ⊖); see Erosion (morphology).
A coming together of two or more people; a meeting.
A formal gathering or assembly; a conference held to discuss or decide on a specific question.
(often capitalized: Congress) A legislative body of a state, originally the bicameral legislature of the United States of America.
An association, especially one consisting of other associations or representatives of interest groups.
definitions.example: The National Congress of American Indians

definitions.definition: Coitus; sexual intercourse.
To assemble together.
To meet in a congress.

A kick awarded to the attacking team when the ball leaves the field of play by wholly crossing the goal line without a goal having been scored, having last touched a player from the defending team. For the kick, the ball is placed within the corner arc closest to where it went out of play.
An area of low fertility and habitation, a desolate place.
definitions.example: The pine barrens are a site lonely enough to suit any hermit.

definitions.definition: Unable to bear children; sterile.
definitions.example: I silently wept as my daughter's husband rejected her. What would she do now that she was no longer a maiden but also barren?

definitions.definition: Of poor fertility, infertile; not producing vegetation.
Bleak.
Unproductive; fruitless; unprofitable; empty.
Mentally dull; stupid.
(film genre) A film or television programme presented as if it were a documentary but that is not factual and often a parody or satire.
The creation of charts and maps based on the layout of a territory's geography.
An illustrative discussion of a topic.
A broad, well-paved and landscaped thoroughfare.
The landscaping on the sides of a boulevard or other thoroughfare.
A person who poses questions to contestants on a quiz show.
A short earthenware pipe, placed on top of a chimney to improve the draft.
Primarily, a square; hence, a square body of troops; a body of troops drawn up in a square.
A body of cavalry comprising two companies or troops, averaging from one hundred and twenty to two hundred soldiers.
A body of infantrymen made up of several platoons, averaging from eighty to one hundred and fifty men, and led by a captain or a major.
A detachment of vessels employed on any particular service or station, under the command of the senior officer
definitions.example: the North Atlantic Squadron

definitions.definition: (air force) A tactical air force unit; consists of at least two flights; multiple squadrons make up a group or wing (depending on particular air force).
(U.S. Space Force) A spaceforce unit; multiple squadrons make up an operations delta or a support garrison.
Global warming.
A person who plays the violin
Any substance added to a food product to enhance its taste, especially to make it taste more savoury or to add umami
A school which provides board and lodging as well as tuition, with students going home at weekends or between terms.
By extension a boarding school in which a dominant or colonial culture whitewashes a subordinate one de-culturizing the students of their native language, customs, religion, and culture.
A sharp, hooked claw of a bird of prey or other predatory animal.
One of certain small prominences on the hind part of the face of an elephant's tooth.
A kind of moulding, concave at the bottom and convex at the top; an ogee. (When the concave part is at the top, it is called an inverted talon.)
The shoulder of the bolt of a lock on which the key acts to shoot the bolt.
In various card games, the remaining stock of undealt cards.
A strip of cloth worn around the neck and tied in the front. See also bowtie.
An expression of gratitude.
A short prayer said at meals; grace, a benediction.
A public celebration in acknowledgement of divine favour.
A vehicle that is used to push snow off surfaces such as roads.
A device attached to a vehicle to enable it to be used for removing snow.
A maneuver/manoeuvre in skiing in which the tips of the skis point inwards and the back ends point outwards, imitating a snow plow.
To clear (roads, etc) using a snow plow.
To perform a snow plow in skiing.
A shot in billiards or snooker in which the cue ball strikes two other balls; a carom.
Pertaining to the game of billiards.
definitions.example: a billiard table; a billiard ball

definitions.definition: A dynamical system in which a particle alternates between motion in a straight line and specular reflections from a boundary.
1015, a thousand billion (long scale) or a million milliard.
The process of becoming rotten; putrefaction.
Decaying matter.
Any of several diseases in which breakdown of tissue occurs.
Verbal nonsense.
To suffer decomposition due to biological action, especially by fungi or bacteria.
definitions.example: The apple left in the cupboard all that time had started to rot.

definitions.definition: To decline in function or utility.
definitions.example: Your brain will rot if you spend so much time on the computer, Tony!

definitions.definition: To (cause to) deteriorate in any way, as in morals; to corrupt.
To make putrid; to cause to be wholly or partially decomposed by natural processes.
definitions.example: to rot vegetable fiber

definitions.definition: To spend a long period of time (in an unpleasant place).
definitions.example: to rot in Hell

definitions.definition: To expose, as flax, to a process of maceration, etc., for the purpose of separating the fiber; to ret.
To talk nonsense.
A domestic utensil with fibers bound together at the end of a long handle, used for sweeping.
An implement with which players sweep the ice to make a stone travel further and curl less; a sweeper.
Any of several yellow-flowered shrubs of the family Fabaceae, in the tribe Genisteae, including genera Cytisus, Genista, and Spartium, with long, thin branches and small or few leaves.
A gun, because it is more or less long, held similarly to a besom and “cleans” what is in front.
To sweep with a broom.
(roofing) To improve the embedding of a membrane by using a broom or squeegee to smooth it out and ensure contact with the adhesive under the membrane.
To clean (e.g. a ship's bottom of clinging shells, seaweed, etc.) by the application of fire and scraping.
A written account of something, as a record.
An increase made to the book value of an asset that was previously undervalued.
A review published in the print or online media for a film, book, etc.
definitions.example: The film had poor write-ups, but I ended up enjoying it anyway.

definitions.definition: One who writes for the screen, who writes drama for film or television; especially a professional who knows the conventions appropriate to such work.
A type of open shoe made up of straps or bands holding a sole to the foot
Sandalwood
A long narrow boat used on the Barbary coast.
A dish prepared in this manner.
Of a style of Indian dish in which the main ingredient (such as chicken) is marinated, usually (but not necessarily) cooked in a tandoor and served in a masala sauce.
The summit of a mountain.
Situated or occurring on the summit of a mountain.
To trouble aggressively, to harass.
To annoy, irritate.
To cause (mental) suffering to; to distress.
To twist, to weave.
To be irritated; to fret.
To toss back and forth; to agitate; to disquiet.
Annoyed, irritated or distressed
definitions.example: She became more and more vexed as she struggled to cope with the demands of the job.

definitions.definition: Much debated, discussed or disputed
A smooth-talking person.
A drink made from whole fruit, thus thicker than fruit juice.
A member of the mod subculture who is relatively non-violent and wears expensive clothing.
Any major regional biological community such as that of forest or desert
All the genomes of such a community
The act or process of augmenting.
A particular mark of honour, granted by the sovereign in consideration of some noble action, or by favour; and either quartered with the family arms, or on an escutcheon or canton.
A surgical procedure to enlarge a body part, as breast augmentation.
The stage of a disease during which symptoms increase or continue.
A compositional technique where the composer lengthens the melody by lengthening its note values.
An increase of stipend obtained by a parish minister by an action raised in the Court of Teinds against the titular and heritors.
To produce or deposit (eggs) in water.
To generate, bring into being, especially non-mammalian beings in very large numbers.
To bring forth in general.
definitions.example: The Web server spawns a new process to handle each client's request.

definitions.definition: To induce (aquatic organisms) to spawn.
To plant with fungal spawn.
To deposit (numerous) eggs in water.
To reproduce, especially in large numbers.
(of a character or object) (To cause) to appear spontaneously in a game at a certain point and time.
The numerous eggs of an aquatic organism.
Mushroom mycelium prepared for (aided) propagation.
(by extension, sometimes derogatory) Any germ or seed, even a figurative source; offspring.
The buds or branches produced from underground stems.
The location in a game where characters or objects spontaneously appear.
A chronic eating disorder characterized by a binge-and-purge cycle - extreme overeating followed by self-induced vomiting.
An empress of several Eastern European countries, especially Russia, or the wife of a tsar.
A funeral director; someone whose business is to manage funerals, burials and cremations.

A person receiving land in Ireland during the Elizabethan era, so named because they gave an undertaking to abide by several conditions regarding marriage, to be loyal to the crown, and to use English as their spoken language.
A contractor for the royal revenue in England, one of those who undertook to manage the House of Commons for the king in the Addled Parliament of 1614.
One who undertakes or commits to doing something.
A day for manoeuvres and tactical exercises in "the field".
A school day for athletic events; a sports day.
A day of class taken away from school for a field trip.
A great time or a great deal to do; a period of bustling activity.
definitions.example: They went to the park and had a field day playing on the swings.

definitions.definition: A great time or a great deal to do, at somebody else's expense.
definitions.example: The reporters will have a field day with a comment like that.

definitions.definition: (specifically US Navy, US Coast Guard and US Marine Corps) A day on which there is top-to-bottom all-hands cleaning.
A religious leader in Twelver Shi'ism.
An authority on any subject.
A round sweet and juicy stone fruit, resembling peach or plum in taste, with a yellow-orange flesh, lightly fuzzy skin and a large seed inside.
The apricot tree, Prunus armeniaca
A pale yellow-orange colour, like that of an apricot fruit.
A dog with an orange-coloured coat.
The junction of the brain and brain stem on a target, used as an aiming point to ensure a one-shot kill.
(usually in the plural) A testicle.
Of a pale yellowish-orange colour, like that of an apricot.
An estimate that is too low.
To perceive (someone or something) as having a lower value, quantity, worth, etc., than what he/she/it actually has.
The official who presides over a tennis game sat on a high chair.
One of the two white-coated officials who preside over a cricket match.
One of usually 4 officials who preside over a baseball game.
definitions.example: The umpire called the pitch a strike.

definitions.definition: The official who stands behind the line on the defensive side.
definitions.example: The umpire must keep on his toes as the play often occurs around him.

definitions.definition: A match official on the ground deciding and enforcing the rules during play. As of 2007 the Australian Football League uses 3, or in the past 2 or just 1. The other officials, the goal umpires and boundary umpires, are normally not called just umpires alone.
A person who arbitrates between contending parties.
The official who presides over a curling game.
To act as an umpire in a game.
To decide as an umpire.
A certified carbon dioxide emission displacement credit, supposed to be equal to one tonne of carbon dioxide removed from the environment.
A coxswain of a boat, especially of a racing crew.
To act as coxswain for.
definitions.example: I coxed the lightweight 4+ yesterday.

definitions.definition: A stringed instrument, with strings stretched across a sounding board, usually trapezoidal. It is played on the lap or horizontally on a table. Some have their own legs. These musical instruments are played by plucking on the strings (traditionally with a quill) or by tapping on them (in the case of the hammer dulcimers).
A room, in a home or hotel, where meals are eaten. Some restaurants provide private dining rooms for hire, away from the main public eating areas.
Clothes for wearing to bed and sleeping in, usually consisting of a loose-fitting shirt and pants/trousers.
Loose-fitting trousers worn by both sexes in various southern Asian countries including India.
In an alternative way
Used to link a pair of possibilities

To cut into a surface with an acid or other corrosive substance in order to make a pattern. Best known as a technique for creating printing plates, but also used for decoration on metal, and, in modern industry, to make circuit boards.
To engrave a surface.
To make a lasting impression.
definitions.example: The memory of 9/11 is etched into my mind.

definitions.definition: To sketch; to delineate.
An aftergrowth of grass (or other plants) which grows after it has been been mowed; also, a field of such growth.
To deprive of nerve, force, or strength; to weaken; to enfeeble.
definitions.example: to unnerve the arm

definitions.definition: To make somebody nervous, upset, alarm, shake the resolve of.
definitions.example: I was greatly unnerved by the news that my attacker was back in the country.

definitions.definition: A particularly powerful opioid narcotic painkiller, N-phenyl-N-[1-(2-phenylethyl)piperidin-4-yl]propanamide.
A head-on conflict or direct competition.
definitions.example: The public debate became a heated mano a mano between the two leading candidates.

definitions.definition: In close confrontation
definitions.example: We sat tensely in the courtroom while the mano-a-mano struggle ensued between the two skilled lawyers.

definitions.definition: Characterized by head-to-head competition or conflict.
definitions.example: The newcomer brashly engaged the veteran player mano a mano.

definitions.definition: The reestablishment of friendly relations; conciliation or rapprochement.
definitions.example: He longed for reconciliation with his estranged father, but too many painful memories kept him from making contact again.

definitions.definition: The end of estrangement between a human and God as a result of the process of atonement.
A Roman Catholic sacrament involving contrition, confession, punishment and absolution; penance.
Process of matching, comparing and agreeing figures from accounting records against those presented on a bank statement, including list of explainable differences.
Food consumed before going to bed.
Any meal eaten in the evening; dinner eaten in the evening, rather than at noon.
A meal from a chip shop consisting of a deep-fried food with chips.
definitions.example: a fish supper; a pizza supper

definitions.definition: To consume a snack before retiring.
To eat dinner (see above).
A drinker, especially one who drinks slowly (i.e., one who sups).

A large, crepuscular, semiaquatic rodent (Myocastor coypus) resembling a large rat, having bright orange-yellow incisors, native to South America and introduced to Europe, Asia and North America, valued for its fur in eastern Europe and central Asia and considered a pest elsewhere.
